name: Criminal property damage in the first degree
text:
PART III.  CRIMINAL DAMAGE TO PROPERTY

     (1)  A person commits the offense of criminal property damage in the first degree if:



	(a)	The person intentionally or knowingly damages property and thereby recklessly places another person in danger of death or bodily injury; or
	(b)	The person intentionally or knowingly damages the property of another, without the other's consent, in an amount exceeding $20,000.



	(2)  Criminal property damage in the first degree is a class B felony. [L 1972, c 9, pt of §1; gen ch 1993; am L 1996, c 170, §1; am L 2003, c 19, §1]
